definition: to be in season/seasonal
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
classifier for a ream of paper
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to wave a chicken feather as a token of authority (idiom); to assume unwarranted authority on the basis of some pretext
pinyin: na2 zhe5 ji1 mao2 dang4 ling4 jian4

sentences.english: The competent authority will release relevant information in due course.
sentences.chinese: 有关部分将当令发布有关动静。

sentences.english: You can certainly experiment with whatever vegetables are in season where you are.
sentences.chinese: 当然你可以尝试用其他各种当令蔬菜。

sentences.english: The stripping pressure for the press tonnage will be calculated with the die closed.
sentences.chinese: 冲床吨位中的脱料力应为模具闭当令的压力。

sentences.english: Nothing says summer quite like the taste of fresh, in-season produce.
sentences.chinese: 习惯上，夏天是品尝新鲜和当令食品的季节。

sentences.english: And they're not the ones benefiting from the fall in seasonal food prices.
sentences.chinese: 而且他们也没能从当令食物的降价中受益。

sentences.english: Dangling dry autumn air, easily injured Jinye, the diet should be Ziyin Runfei suitable.
sentences.chinese: 秋季燥气当令，易伤津液，故饮食应以滋阴润肺为宜。

definition: typical weather in a given season
the 10 heavenly stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
menstruation/woman's period
the Yuezhi, an ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty (also written 月氏[Yue4 zhi1])
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
10th earthly branch: 5-7 p.m., 8th solar month (8th September-7th October), year of the Rooster/ancient Chinese compass point: 270° (west)
the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
robust/healthy/vigorous/energetic
1-3 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
51st year A3 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1974 or 2034
unlucky/inauspicious/ominous
first two of the twelve earthly branches 十二地支/by ext., the earthly branches
3-5 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
fifth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fifth in order/letter "E" or Roman "V" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/penta
forty-ninth year I1 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1972 or 2032
